alert.note: Alert for Calabasas and Agoura Hills; Central Ventura County Valleys; Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Eastern Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area; Interstate 5 Corridor; Malibu Coast; Northern Ventura County Mountains; Santa Clarita Valley; Santa Susana Mountains; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Ventura County Beaches; Ventura County Inland Coast; Western San Fernando Valley; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor; Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 10 at 9:22AM PST until December 10 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM TODAY OVER MOST OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... .Gusty Santa Ana winds combined with very low relative humidities will continue to bring critical Red Flag conditions to much of LA and Ventura counties today. Wind gusts of 30 to 50 mph will be common this morning, with isolated gusts of 50 to 60 mph in favored foothill and mountain locations, such as the Santa Susana Mountains. Winds will begin to diminish this afternoon, with much less wind by tonight and Monday. Widespread single digit humidities will affect the region today, as low as 5 percent. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY OVER MOST OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... * Winds...Northeast winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts 35 to 50 mph will be common this morning, with winds expected to gradually diminish this afternoon. Strongest winds this morning will be in the mountains and foothills, especially the Santa Susana mountains, where isolated gusts of 50 to 60 mph will continue. * Relative Humidity...Minimums 5 to 15 percent common today. Very poor overnight recoveries of 12 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...If fire ignition occurs, conditions may be favorable for extreme fire behavior which would threaten life and property.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. Use extreme caution with anything that can spark a wildfire. Residents near wildland interfaces should be prepared to evacuate if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information.
